本: The Making of a Japanese Periphery, 1750-1920 . University of California Press . 1995
説明文: the production of paper hairdress ties (motoyui), which came into vogue among both men and women of the samurai class after 1600. (p.86)  Although the scale of production for decorative cordage and umbrellas would remain relatively small until the nineteenthe century, the hairdress-tie and papermaking industries quickly became major elements of the region's commercial economy.
